who has led Google for a decade, will become executive chairman focusing on external relations, deals and government relations.New Yorker writer Ken Auletta , who has written a book on the company, reported Friday that Eric Schmidt had been nudged aside. " Ken Auletta said that after losing out to Page and co-founder Sergey Brin over the company's China policy a year ago, " Eric Schmidt lost some energy and focus. " Eric Schmidt was also criticized for allowing Google to be overtaKen Auletta by Facebook, for the company's increasingly frequent privacy scandals and its increasing internal bureaucracy. Together with the co- founders, he decided to step aside.In announcing the move Thursday, Eric Schmidt said that the company no longer needed his "adult supervision and that Page, 38, was ready to run the world's leading internet company. The British version is wildly entertaining, but also has a penchant for stirring up controversy. You never know what Simon Cowell has up his sleeve, and since he will be working both behind and in front of the camera, the country should brace itself to expect the unexpected. While we don't miss Simon Cowell on "American Idol" that much, this certainly throws a whole new twist on singing competitions in the U.S.
